newsitem.title: UK: IPE oil futures consolidate, trim rally gains.
newsitem.headline: IPE oil futures consolidate, trim rally gains.

text.p: IPE Brent futures trundled along at slightly lower levels on Monday as the market consolidated Friday's gains in a thin holiday market, brokers said.
July Brent was eight cents lower at $20.27 a barrel, while June gas oil was $4.50 up at $177.50 a tonne at 1459 GMT.
Brokers attributed the modest losses to consolidation following July Brent's 86 cent gain on Friday, and many said the fact the contract had held well above $20 was a positive sign.
Some looked for greater volume to confirm the gains but with many European players away from the market due to public holidays, that appeared unlikely.
Gas oil was stronger as it played catch-up with the Brent gains as well as strength in NYMEX heating oil at the end of last week.
"It's being helped by the fact that Brent's remained relatively strong," said one broker.
"It's very quiet. There's hardly any paper out there and I"m expecting it to drift off a bit it's just a question of when it will start doing so," the trader added.
